dialogs.text: You‚Äôve been thinking about what Aira said yesterday. Hackathons aren‚Äôt about perfection ‚Äî they‚Äôre about possibility. You open your laptop.

events.prompt: What kind of challenge excites you the most?

dialogs.text: Eco-innovator detected! Sustainability challenges are huge at hackathons ‚Äî from waste reduction to renewable energy apps. A noble cause, and technology can help make it happen.
A learning enthusiast! EdTech is one of the hottest hackathon categories. Projects that make learning fun and accessible can really stand out.

Tech for all ‚Äî I like it! Accessibility projects make digital spaces inclusive. Whether for young or old, improving access always matters.
Nice! That‚Äôs your theme seed. Every big project starts with just one spark. Now, let‚Äôs take it further.
Aira waves her hand ‚Äî the panels merge into a glowing holographic mind map resembling a chalkboard in cyberspace.
Imagine this formula: Problem + Technology + Impact = Idea. Think of it like a recipe. Let‚Äôs cook up some innovation!
After minutes of brainstorming, you lie down on a cold data floor, frustrated. Everything feels done before.

That‚Äôs a myth. Innovation doesn‚Äôt always mean new. Sometimes it means better, simpler, or more human. Small ideas can make big differences.

Okay‚Ä¶ I think I‚Äôm ready to try this brainstorming thing.
Perfect! Because here comes your next challenge.
